channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid in Wales: No significant changes to rules in latest review
item.description: First minister urges those who haven't been vaccinated to get their jab as he announces latest review.

item.title: Covid case rates in Wales highest since January
item.description: But Public Health Wales figures show deaths and hospital admissions remain much lower.

item.title: Family 'devastated' as teacher, 23, dies after Narberth car crash.
item.description: Beca Mai Richards's organs will be donated to "provide a better life for others as her final gift".

item.title: Blood tests: Charities concerned over postponements
item.description: Doctors in Wales advised to postpone non-urgent blood tests because of blood tube shortages.

item.title: Books: Bid for more diverse heroes in Welsh children's stories
item.description: Author Jessica Dunrod says it's important for black children to see themselves in literature.

item.title: Scrapping theory tests could cut HGV driver shortage, says instructor
item.description: One lorry driving instructor said it can take up to 16 months to train up new drivers.

item.title: Two charged with murder of 57-year-old man in Wrexham
item.description: Two local men will appear before magistrates on Friday charged with murder.

item.title: Man arrested in Shotton murder probe as woman found dead
item.description: A woman, 27, was found dead at a property and a man, 29, has been arrested on suspicion of murder.

item.title: Brexit: Staff shortages hitting supermarket shelves in Wales
item.description: Industry bosses say they cannot staff their workforces from within UK.

item.title: Llangollen Railway trains vandalised with graffiti
item.description: It will take thousands of pounds and hours of volunteers' time to restore them, the railway says.

item.title: Swansea City step up Covid precautions
item.description: Swansea City are having to limit access to their training ground in an attempt to curb the club's Covid-19 cases.

item.title: Gower: Power boat and water bike 'terrorise' swimmers
item.description: Mumbles Coastguard received complaints they were getting dangerously close to bathers at Langland Bay.

item.title: Wales donates unneeded PPE to help Covid-hit Namibia
item.description: Masks, gowns and sanitiser are being sent to help the country as it struggles with a third wave.

item.title: Simon Hart: 'Thinking Boris could die was sobering moment'
item.description: Welsh Secretary Simon Hart talks about Prime Minister Boris Johnson's admission to intensive care with Covid.

item.title: Ex-RAF paramedic relieved 'vital' Afghan interpreter now in UK
item.description: Rachel Pompa speaks of her joy as an interpreter she worked with finally lands in the UK.

item.title: Water bike and boat pass 'terrified' swimmers at speed
item.description: Swansea Council is investigating the incident which made members of the public "very concerned".

item.title: Covid: Calls to investigate cost of travel tests in Wales
item.description: Tory MP David TC Davies says people in Wales should be able to shop around for a PCR test supplier.

item.title: Levelling up: Lessons from Rhyl on the changes needed
item.description: The BBC asks locals in the town of Rhyl how the government's levelling up agenda could help them.

item.title: Champions Hockey League: Cardiff Devils 0-5 Adler Mannheim
item.description: The Cardiff Devils' long-awaited return to action ended in a 5-0 defeat against Adler Mannheim.

item.title: Cardiff Devils: Coach and two players to miss CHL tie because of Covid protocols
item.description: Cardiff Devils head coach Jarrod Skalde and two players will miss Thursday's Champions Hockey League match with Adler Mannheim due to Covid-19 protocols.

item.title: Kieffer Moore: Speculation won't distract striker, says Cardiff boss Mick McCarthy
item.description: Cardiff City manager Mick McCarthy says Kieffer Moore has his "mind on the job" despite transfer speculation as the deadline approaches.

item.title: WRU domestic league start brought forward
item.description: The WRU brings forward the start date for the 2021-22 domestic league season to November, having initially decided to delay it until January.

item.title: Rugby League World Cup 2021: New dates announced for postponed tournament
item.description: Rugby League World Cup bosses announce new dates for the postponed 2021 tournament.

item.title: Dim newidiadau sylweddol i reolau Covid yng Nghymru
item.description: Bydd yr adolygiad nesaf yn ystyried a oes angen prawf o fod wedi cael brechlyn i gael mynediad i leoliadau risg uchel.

item.title: Gweinidog yn 'gofidio' am gynnydd Covid mewn pobl dros 60
item.description: Daw wrth i feddyg ddweud bod ysbytai'n "orlawn" gyda phobl sydd angen triniaeth am bethau heblaw Covid.

item.title: Teyrnged i fenyw 23 oed fu farw yn dilyn gwrthdrawiad
item.description: Teyrnged teulu i athrawes ifanc a fu farw yn yr ysbyty ddyddiau wedi gwrthdrawiad yn Sir Benfro.

item.title: Clybiau ieuenctid LHDT Gogledd Cymru yn mynd o nerth i nerth
item.description: Celt Hughes ac Aled Griffiths sy'n trafod effaith y clybiau ar eu bywydau a'r gymuned.

item.title: Hoci iâ yn ôl yng Nghymru am y tro cyntaf ers 18 mis
item.description: Mae Devils Caerdydd yn paratoi am eu gêm gyntaf ers Mawrth 2020 yn erbyn Adler Mannheim o'r Almaen.
